name: UI Fabric
description: Fabric’s robust, up-to-date web controls are built with the React framework. Look through the control list to see the building blocks that are available using Fabric React.

concepts.name: allowFreeform
concepts.description: Whether the ComboBox is free form, meaning that the user input is not bound to provided options. Defaults to false.

concepts.description: When options are scrollable the selected option is positioned at the top of the callout when it is opened (unless it has reached the end of the scrollbar).

components.name: Breadcrumb
components.description: Breadcrumbs should be used as a navigational aid in your app or site. They indicate the current page’s location within a hierarchy and help the user understand where they are in relation to the rest of that hierarchy. They also afford one-click access to higher levels of that hierarchy.

concepts.name: basic
concepts.description: Basic Breadcrumb

concepts.name: overflow
concepts.description: Breadcrumb with overflow

components.name: TeachingBubble
components.description: A teaching bubble brings attention to a new or important feature, with the goal of increasing engagement with the feature. A teaching bubble typically follows a coach mark.

concepts.name: teaching bubble

components.name: Callout
components.description: A callout is an anchored tip that can be used to teach people or guide them through the app without blocking them.

concepts.name: callout

components.name: Dialog
components.description: A dialog box is a temporary pop-up that takes focus from the page or app and requires people to interact with it. It’s primarily used for confirming actions, such as deleting a file, or asking people to make a choice.

concepts.name: dialog
concepts.description: A dialog box is a temporary pop-up that takes focus from the page or app and requires people to interact with it. It’s primarily used for confirming actions, such as deleting a file, or asking people to make a choice.

components.name: Modal
components.description: Modals are temporary pop-ups that take focus from the page or app and require people to interact with them. Unlike a dialog box, a modal should be used for hosting lengthy content, such as privacy statements or license agreements, or for asking people to perform complex or multiple actions, such as changing settings.

components.name: Image
components.defition: An image is a graphic representation of something (e.g photo or illustration).

concepts.name: default
concepts.description: By default, frame remains at its natural size with no image scaling

concepts.name: contain
concepts.description: Causes the image to scale up or down proportionally

concepts.name: centerContain
concepts.description: Causes the image to scale up or down proportionally, centering images smaller than their frame

concepts.name: none
concepts.description: Causes the image to crop if the frame is smaller than the image

concepts.name: center
concepts.description: Behaves as 'none' while centering the image within the frame

concepts.name: cover
concepts.description: Causes the image to scale up or down proportionally

concepts.name: centerCover
concepts.description: Behaves as 'cover' with centering of the image within the frame

concepts.name: maximizeFrame
concepts.description: Expands image to fill the container

concepts.name: center
concepts.description: Centers the image within the frame

components.name: Stack
components.definition: A Stack is a container-type component that abstracts the implementation of a flexbox in order to define the layout of its children components.
